meanings.definition: The quality or state of being incorrupt.
meanings.sent1: Her incorruptness in handling finances earned her the trust of everyone in the company.
meanings.sent2: The incorruptness of the ancient artifact amazed the archaeologists.
meanings.sent3: The incorruptness of the cake after a week left us all surprised.
meanings.sent4: His speech was filled with incorruptness, inspiring the audience.
meanings.sent5: The knight's armor symbolized his incorruptness in the face of temptation.

meanings.definition: The absence of corruption or decay.
meanings.sent1: The incorruptness of the forest was a testament to its untouched beauty.
meanings.sent2: We were in awe of the incorruptness of the historical documents.
meanings.sent3: The incorruptness of the fruit made it a perfect snack for the picnic.
meanings.sent4: The incorruptness of her ideals shone brightly in a world filled with deceit.
meanings.sent5: The incorruptness of the diamond made it a valuable treasure.
